SEARCH
Module HMS
Package utility

Class Utility

java.lang.Object
utility.Utility
public class Utility extends Object
Provides utility functions for file operations such as reading and writing CSV files. Handles file validation, reading, and updating line-by-line.
Since:
19/11/2024
Version:
1.0
Author:
Jan Chen Jie

  • Constructor Details

    • Utility

      public Utility()

  • Method Details

    • isValidPath

      public static boolean isValidPath(String filePath)
      Checks if the given file path is valid, readable, and refers to a file.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The file path to validate.
      Returns:
      True if the file path is valid, otherwise false.

    • readCSV

      public static List<String[]> readCSV(String filePath, int removeHeaderFlag) throws IOException
      Reads data from a CSV file and returns it as a list of string arrays.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path of the CSV file to read.
      removeHeaderFlag - A flag to indicate whether to skip the header row (1 to remove, 0 to keep).
      Returns:
      A list of string arrays representing the CSV rows.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while reading the file.

    • updateLineByLineCSV

      public static void updateLineByLineCSV(String filePath) throws IOException
      Updates a CSV file line by line, replacing any "null" values with empty strings.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path of the CSV file to update.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while updating the file.

    • writeCSV

      public static void writeCSV(String filePath, List<String[]> data) throws IOException
      Writes data to a CSV file, overwriting its current content.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path of the CSV file to write to.
      data - A list of string arrays representing the rows to write.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs while writing to the file.
